title: Milton-Montford, Baltimore
text:
Milton-Montford is a <a href="neighborhood">neighborhood</a> in the heart of East <a href="Baltimore">Baltimore</a>, <a href="Maryland">Maryland</a>. Milton-Montford lies north of <a href="Patterson%20Park">Patterson Park</a> and south of <a href="Amtrak">Amtrak</a>'s <a href="Northeast%20Corridor">Northeast Corridor</a>. The neighborhood is bounded by the neighborhoods of <a href="McElderry%20Park%2C%20Baltimore">McElderry Park</a> to the south, <a href="Madison-Eastend%2C%20Baltimore">Madison-Eastend</a> to the east, <a href="Biddle%20Street%2C%20Baltimore">Biddle Street</a> to the north, and <a href="Middle%20East%2C%20Baltimore">Middle East</a> to the west. The swath of land between <a href="Johns%20Hopkins%20Hospital">Johns Hopkins Hospital</a> and Frank C Bocek Park, which includes Milton-Montford, is often referred to as the "Down the Hill" neighborhood by local residents.
History.
The neighborhood lies within the <a href="East%20Monument%20Historic%20District">East Monument Historic District</a>. The district is historically significant due to the large <a href="History%20of%20the%20Czechs%20in%20Baltimore">Czech-American</a> immigrant community that once lived in the area. Milton-Montford has since transitioned to a majority <a href="African-American%20neighborhood">African-American neighborhood</a>.
Milton-Montford is a neighborhood in transition due to <a href="gentrification">gentrification</a> driven by <a href="Johns%20Hopkins%20Hospital">Johns Hopkins Hospital</a>. Sales of houses have increased since 2016 and prices have soared. Cost of real estate in Milton-Montford neighborhood has increased partly because of the nearby Station East redevelopment.
